item.title: CompositeLayoutInterface
item.description: TypeInterface definitions ReuseIRCompositeLayoutInterface (ReuseIRCompositeLayoutInterface) Unified interface for converting type to LLVM struct layout. Methods: getCompositeLayout ::mlir::reuse_ir::CompositeLayout getCompositeLayout(::mlir::DataLayout dataLayout); Get the CompositeLayout of the type. NOTE: This method must be implemented by the user.

item.title: Dialect
item.description: ‘reuse_ir’ Dialect IR for memory reuse analysis

item.title: MangleInterface
item.description: TypeInterface definitions ReuseIRMangleInterface (ReuseIRMangleInterface) Mangle the type so that we have a unique name for its associated functions. Methods: formatMangledNameTo void formatMangledNameTo(::llvm::raw_ostream &buffer); Return the mangled name of the type. NOTE: This method must be implemented by the user.

item.title: Ops
item.description: reuse_ir.clone (reuse_ir::CloneOp) Make sure the object behind the reference can be value-copied Syntax: operation ::= `reuse_ir.clone` `(` $object `:` type($object) `)` (`tag` `(` $tag^ `)`)? attr-dict `:` type($result) reuse_ir.clone applies shadow copy to the object behind the reference. That is, it will increase the reference count of sub fields if necessary. Attributes: AttributeMLIR TypeDescription tag::mlir::IntegerAttrindex attribute Operands: Operand Description object ReuseIR Reference Type Results: Result Description result any type reuse_ir.

item.title: Passes
item.description: -convert-reuse-ir-to-llvm Convert Low-level ReuseIR Operations to LLVM IR This pass is serves as the last step in the ReuseIR pipeline. It converts all remaining low-level ReuseIR operations to LLVM IR. ### `-reuse-ir-acquire-release-fusion` _Fuse ReuseIR acquire and release Operations_ This pass is used to fuse acquire and release operations. ### `-reuse-ir-closure-outlining` _Outlines ReuseIR Closures_ This pass outlines closures and instantiates their virtual tables. ### `-reuse-ir-expand-control-flow` _Expand structured control flows for ReuseIR operations_ This pass is used to expand control flows for ReuseIR operations.

item.title: Types
item.description: BFloat16Type bfloat16 floating-point type ComplexType Complex number with a parameterized element type Syntax: complex-type ::= `complex` `<` type `>` The value of complex type represents a complex number with a parameterized element type, which is composed of a real and imaginary value of that element type. The element must be a floating point or integer scalar type. Example: complex<f32> complex<i32> Parameters: Parameter C++ type Description elementType Type Float6E2M3FNType 6-bit floating point with 2-bit exponent and 3-bit mantissa
